detaileddescription.para: String containing the CVS revision. Read out via reflection!

Represents the "roulette wheel." Each key in the Map is a Chromosome and each value is an instance of the SlotCounter inner class, which keeps track of how many slots on the wheel each Chromosome is occupying.
Keeps track of the total number of slots that are in use on the roulette wheel. This is equal to the combined fitness values of all Chromosome instances that have been added to this wheel.
An internal pool in which discarded SlotCounter instances can be stored so that they can be reused over and over again, thus saving memory and the overhead of constructing new ones each time.
Attention: The configuration used is the one set with the static method Genotype.setConfiguration.

Select a given number of Chromosomes from the pool that will move on to the next generation population. This selection should be guided by the fitness values, but fitness should be treated as a statistical probability of survival, not as the sole determining factor. In other words, Chromosomes with higher fitness values should be more likely to be selected than those with lower fitness values, but it should not be guaranteed.

parameterdescription.para: the number of Chromosomes to select
the population the Chromosomes will be added to

detaileddescription.para: Empty out the working pool of Chromosomes.

simplesect.para: always false as some Chromosome's could be returnd multiple times

detaileddescription.para: Not supported by this selector! Please do not use it.

simplesect.para: TRUE: doublette chromosomes allowed to be added by the selector

detaileddescription.para: Add a chromosome instance to this selector's working pool of chromosomes.

parameterdescription.para: the chromosom to add to the pool

memberdef.argsstring: (final RandomGenerator a_generator, final double[] a_fitnessValues, double[] a_counterValues, final IChromosome[] a_chromosomes)
memberdef.name: spinWheel

detaileddescription.para: This method "spins" the wheel and returns the Chromosome that is "landed upon." Each time a chromosome is selected, one instance of it is removed from the wheel so that it cannot be selected again.

parameterdescription.para: the random number generator to be used during the spinning process
an array of fitness values of the respective Chromosomes
an array of total counter values of the respective Chromosomes
the respective Chromosome instances from which selection is to occur

simplesect.para: selected Chromosome from the roulette wheel

detaileddescription.para: A basic implementation of NaturalSelector that models a roulette wheel. When a Chromosome is added, it gets a number of "slots" on the wheel equal to its fitness value. When the select method is invoked, the wheel is "spun" and the Chromosome occupying the spot on which it lands is selected. Then the wheel is spun again and again until the requested number of Chromosomes have been selected. Since Chromosomes with higher fitness values get more slots on the wheel, there's a higher statistical probability that they'll be chosen, but it's not guaranteed.
